data.title: Delicious!
data.text:
Yum!  Chicken pita was fantastic. Cooked perfectly with Greek spices. 

Also, always fun to get the little free ice cream cone. Very good!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Overpriced bland hot dogs over salted fries.  $23 for 3 hotdogs,two fries and two sodas what a rip off!!

data.title: Inconsistently less than good
data.text: Just not real good.  I've tried many different things and nothing stands out.  I used to love Portillo's until they sold their chain.  Now they're not very good.  Time for someone to open a competitor.  Photo's could have been it but they missed the mark.

data.title: Good quick eats
data.text: Photo's is kind of a unique restaurant in that it's fast food, but it's not a chain and they do a real good job on keeping the prices down for families and teens.  I'm a big fan of their dogs and beefs and the shakes are outstanding.  Don't forget the free mini ice cream cone after you eat your food.

data.title: Pricey
data.text: I work in Palatine and decided to give it a try. The food is very pricey and they do not offer combos so you must order everything separate. I tried the blue cheese burger and it was very good. Fries are average but for 2.59 they give you a decent amount. Free ice cream but I didnt know until i left so it would be nice if they offered it to you. The service could improve. I was asked what my drink was twice and also what I ordered. If the food wasnt so pricey I would return more often.

data.title: good food, slow service
data.text: I have been there twice in the last month. Food (well, hot dogs...) was good. Both times the service was s.l.o.w.!!! Not quite sure why people who came in after us had there numbers called way before ours but that is what we experienced both times. Don't remember what the problem was the 1st time but yesterday the only thing different that I ordered was the char dog... and cheese fries both times (I will say I LOVE their cheese fries!) They give out free mini ice cream cones so that makes the waiting better...

data.title: Great veggie burger and great community support!
data.text: It is rare for me to find a place that has such a killer veggie burger but the one at Photos is on point!  Skip their fries and their cheese sauce; fries are usually lacking in crispiness and are sometimes cold and the cheese sauce is bland.  But go right for the onion rings that are always hot and crispy!  They have great deals each day of the week offering a different menu item at a discounted price and a very affordable high school student menu.  Photos is great at supporting local schools, teams and clubs!  they often run fundraisers for many of the programs we are involved with and they give large percentages back to the community.  Don't underestimate their salads or their quesadillas, both are excellent in taste and size.  Plus...a free baby ice cream cone when you are done!

data.title: Nice atmosphere but fair food...
data.text:
Stopped in for a late afternoon snack for something different instead of Mickey D's. Okay Hot Dog, but I kinda expected it would come on a poppy seed bun. (It was plain). Wasn't busy so I asked for grilled onion and crunchy French fries. The staff cheerfully accommodated my request.
  The Downside: Diet coke flavor was off. Was surprised to pay almost $8.00 for a dog, fries and drink combo.

data.title: Nice Joint
data.text: We were looking to try something quick and different and found it here. The restaurant was very family friendly and seemed to be a big hit among the high school kids in the area. The staff was friendly and the food was good.

data.title: Average hot dog style restaurant
data.text:
Stop by here on Tuesdays for the 2 for 1 hot dogs for my husband.  I am not a hot dog fan but the hot dogs do smell good. 

I enjoy the tilapia tacos and that is about it.  The salads seem a big pricey as do some of the sandwiches,  

Normally I get a tamale or two when we go to hot dog style restaurants but Photo"s does not sell them.  

Photo's does have daily specials which are worth getting.

data.title: Hot Place plus a lot more
data.text:
Jimmy won for the best Chicago Hot Dog maker in Chicago a few years ago to set his reputation as a sell of hotdogs. As any Greek hot dog place, he has a lot more on his menu then just hot dogs.  My wife likes his fish sandwich, while I like the Maxwell Street Polish he serves.  Besides that, he has burgers, chicken fries and the works.

At the end of the meal, he has gives you a free ice cream cone.

This is a friendly place and always full of families and sport teams. Jimmy supports his commiunity by supporting sports teams and helping nonprofits raise money.by giving a portion of sales back to them when they mention their name.

I would recommend this place to anyone that wants a step up from fast food.  Watch out during the school year because many students come in on thier lunch hour and it gets crowded and loud.  THis only last for about a 1/2 a day.

data.title: Nice for families, and they offer more than just hotdogs!
data.text:
In our opinion, Photos is a good place to go for a casual meal, especially with multi-generational family members.  Most recently we went there with a 90+ year old relative, as well as younger children, and everyone enjoyed it.
 
Photos "decor" includes pictures on the walls and lots of vintage camera equipment on counters around the place, which made our elderly guest reminisce about her youth.  There are wooden booths as well as tables/benches, which aren't the most comfortable, but do stand up well to kids who tend to fidget, kick their feet, spill things, etc.  It's important to know that Photos doesn't have waitstaff to take your food/beverage orders at the tables; Instead, you go up to a central counter and then they call your number when the order is ready.  When it's crowded/noisy, it can be a bit difficult to hear them call...

Besides hot dogs, the menu offers hamburgers and things like chicken pitas, salmon burgers, italian beef, various quesadillas, and when we were there in October they even had special mini brats.  The food quality is so-so, with some items better than others.  Although the "regular menu prices" may seem a bit high, Photos often has coupons in the local papers and advertising circulars and even on their own website. (We had some coupons, so we didn't pay full price.)  On other occasions we've driven by, and their sign has said things like, "Moms eat free on Mother's Day...Dad's eat free on Father's Day" and we know they run other specials, and have weekday discount pricing for local teens with school ID's, too.   

A really nice treat that Photos always offers is a free mini soft-serve ice cream cone to any customer who wants one after their meal, adults and kids alike.  I'm not sure if they have any flavors besides vanilla, but everyone enjoyed them, and agreed we'd have to come back again another day.

data.title: Overpriced chaos
data.text: We went at an off peak time. There were about 20 people there and 15 of us were waiting in line. Service was slow. Food wasn't anything special. Prices were too high for what you got. My chocolate banana smoothie was made with (way too much) artificial banana flavor. I won't be going back.

data.title: Don't go to Photos
data.text:
My cheeseburger was on par with the burgers from my high school cafeteria in the 80's. Maybe worse. 
My wife's chicken gyros made her sick - the next day was spent in the bathroom.  
My daughter's chicken nuggets were worse than average. 
The fries were nothing special. Blah. 
This was our second visit - giving them a second chance, since the first visit was equally bad - the highlight of which was really gross cheese for the cheese fries. 
For all the hot dog/Italian beef/hamburger - type eateries out there, there is no reason to go to Photo's. 
Go to Portillo's instead.

data.title: Decent, but very pricey
data.text: Photo's has good hot dogs and a good selection of food. However, it is very expensive--at least $10 per person, which is a lot for hot dogs. It has a nice atmosphere and would be a fun place to go with kids. They issue a lot of coupons, so if you can get your hands on one, it can lessen the blow.

data.title: Good fast food
data.text: Ate here in April and a few time prior also. Photo's is always good. My only problem is it does seem a little pricey. My favorite foods are the chicken pitas, cheese fries, and the new French burger with fried egg on top. The drive thru can take a while but it seems food is made to order so it's worth the wait.

data.title: Fast food that is Excellent
data.text: Everytime I go to travel Chicago I make it a point to go here for atminimum one lunch or dinner and have not been disappointed. Tried something new this time...the Italian beef Quesadilla is phenomenal and you must try. Chicago food at its best.

data.title: Decent fast food
data.text: Stopped here for a luncheon carry out.  The “Chicago Style” hot dogs were very good and came with everything on them.  The fries were a bit soggy.  The onion rings were very good.

data.title: Bons burgers
data.text:
Les burgers et la déco sont sympa.
Le service était rapide car il n'y avait personne devant nous.
Un peu radin sur les frites je trouve, pas les meilleurs non plus.
